data.title: Manhattan Crossing
data.solution:
# The easy way...

n = int(input())
lastRow = [0] * n
for y in range(n):
    row = list(input())
    lastCell = 0
    for x in range(n):
        val = max(lastCell, lastRow[x])
        if row[x] == 'o':
           val += 1
        lastRow[x] = val
        lastCell = val
print(lastCell)

# The short way...

#   n, grid = int(input()), []
#
#   for i in range(n):
#       grid.append(input())
#
#   def val(x, y): return(1 if grid[y][x] == 'o' else 0) + max(val(x + 1, y),val(x, y + 1)) if x < n and y < n else 0
#
#   print(val(0,0))
data.statement:
Crossing a [[N]]-sized square part of Manhattan from the top left (0,0) corner of the map down to the bottom right, you shall only move <<RIGHT>> or <<DOWN>>.
Your friends live where the lower-case {{o}} are.
What is the max amount of friends you can visit on your way?

data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> An integer [[N]] for the side size of the square map
<<Next [[N]] lines:>> [[N]] chars: The map with the locations of your friends
data.outputDescription: An integer for the max number of visited friends
